attributes.additional_details:
On 14th April, some 230 schoolgirls were abducted in the town of Chibok, Nigera. Whilst 43 have escaped, another 187 are still missing.
(http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-27101714)

In accordance with the United Nations Declaration of Human Rights, we believe that everyone, without distinction of any kind, has the right to life, liberty and security of person.
(http://www.un.org/en/documents/udhr/)

We are committed to raising awareness of this incident which must be considered a breach of the human rights of over 200 young women in Nigeria. We are therefore petitioning the UK government to act in order to free these girls.
